alert.note: Alert for Camden; Chowan; Eastern Currituck; Pasquotank; Perquimans; Western Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 8:23PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Showers with strong gusty winds will impact portions of Camden, Pasquotank, southeastern Perquimans, Currituck and southeastern Chowan Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 821 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking showers with strong gusty winds along a line extending from near Scuppernong to near Columbia to near Buffalo City. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong storms will be near... Burgess around 840 PM EDT. Hertford, Winfall, Weeksville and Point Harbor around 845 PM EDT. Nixonton around 850 PM EDT. Old Trap, Shiloh and Chapanoke around 855 PM EDT. Elizabeth City, Camden, Elizabeth City State University, Grandy, Sanderling, Indiantown and Whitehall Shores around 900 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Bob White Fork, Poplar Branch, Drummond Point, Pierceville, Spot, Saint Johns, Parkville, Tar Corner, Glen Cove and Gregory. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.

area.areaDesc: Camden; Chowan; Eastern Currituck; Pasquotank; Perquimans; Western Currituck
